text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today we are gonna be making something that
has been requested forever!
It’s gonna be Superman Cupcakes!

The ingredients that you will need, will be:
Vegetable oil, 3 eggs, I’m using cage

free organic eggs, yay! So they’re the happy
eggs.

Gluten free, I’m using chocolate cake mix.
1-1/4 cup of water, metal whisk, big
mixing bowl, and a cupcake pan!
Now let’s put it all together!

I’m using, as you can see, a gluten free,
chocolate cake mix, and a lot of people

have been asking me, well you know, I can’t eat gluten,
is there anything I can do that

is a box cake for gluten. And this is a really
good brand, so I would suggest it,

my sister can’t eat gluten, so I would go
to arrowhead mills, they have everything

there, brownie mix, pie crust mix, chocolate
chip cookies, that are all gluten free!
So, this is just to give you an idea.

If you don’t have the time to make something
from complete scratch, you can still
eat gluten free!

So you put in your mix, and the only thing
that’s different about this recipe is

you add 1 thing at a time. So, first we’re
gonna add the eggs.

Got our eggs in, now you’re gonna whisk,
whisk, whisk!
All together!

Now we’re gonna add 1-1/4 cup of water,
and then mix that together too.
Now 1/2 a cup of vegetable oil… Vege-bles!

Once your batter is all mixed together and
is really, really smooth, like so,

then you’re just gonna fill your cupcake
tray. I have these little liners in here

to help me out. Just take some spoons, and
scoop ‘em in!
I like to do 2 scoops.

Once you’ve filled your cupcake trays, like
so, all nice and clean and tidy, just
heat your oven to 325 and bake for 20 minutes.

While the cupcakes are baking, we are going
to work on decoration!

I’ve got the Superman symbol, I just printed
out a bunch of pictures and put it in

word. And you’re gonna tape it down to,
this is just a piece of cardboard.

And you can make them any size that you’d
like. I just made mine a couple

inches, so that they’d fit nicely on top
of the cupcake. Then you’re gonna take a

piece of wax paper, lay it over, the board,
and tape it in the back.

And ta-da! That’s what you want it to look
like. And then you’re just gonna take

2 different cookie icings, we have red and
yellow, and trace out the shape, starting
with red!

Once you finish filling in your Superman symbols,
you’re just gonna let them dry!

And this might take a couple of hours, or
you can even leave them overnight, just
make sure they’re completely dry. Werp!

With our Superman symbols done, now we are
going to make Kryptonite using…

My favorite, apple Jolly Ranchers! So you’re
just gonna unwrap them, oooh! Sticky!

And put them in a plastic, big plastic bag,
I’m using a freezer bag.

Now that you got all of your Jolly Ranchers
in this big bag, you’re gonna

put it on the table on a hard surface, and
take a hammer and
smash, smash, smash, smash, smash!

And it kind of gives it that look of being
like a broken crystal, like Kryptonite.
It’s pretty cool!

Once your cupcakes are done, take them out
of the oven and make sure that they’ve

had plenty of time to cool before you put
frosting on, then you take green frosting.

I have no idea what size this is, it’s just
the jagged teeth… Edge… Tip?

Just a giant jumbo 1, and i put it in a big
freezer bag.

First we’re gonna decorate the Kryptonite
cupcakes.

And you’re just gonna put a circle all the
way around. To get this color green
I just put in a few drops of green food coloring.

Then you’re gonna take all your yummy, green
Jolly Ranchers, and just sprinkle
them on top!

Now we’re going to frost the Superman cupcakes,
and you’re just gonna take blue

frosting, I just put it in a big freezer bag,
with a big round tip on the end,

it’s like, kinda ghetto, I just kind of
jerry-rigged this together.
And then you’re just gonna frost in a circle.

For the finishing touches, we’re gonna take
a very sharp knife, and delicately
take them off of the wax paper, all the Supermans,
and put them on top of the cupcake.

Ta-da! Our Superman cupcakes are all done!
They look amazing!

My favorite are the Kryptonite, because they
smell like Apple Jolly Ranchers!

And I want to eat them all in my face right
now!

Thanks you guys for suggesting it, if you
have any other ideas for any other

Nerdy Nummies, please leave me a comment down
below and I will do

my best to make them happen. Also, you can
subscribe somewhere, I think it’s this

way… Subscribe button over here, and it
will give you a little reminder that
Nerdy Nummies comes out every Tuesday!
So, OK thanks you guys!
Bye-bye!
